Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin R Everson

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Benjamin R Everson in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Benjamin R Everson.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Angel speaks about the pending case in other counties and would like to see what happens with that. Currently there is a hearing on December 12 in the other counties and request a hearing after that date. Court sets jury trial dates. Attorney Harper states that this will be a 1 day jury trial.

Attorney Angel informs the court that BE is currently staying in Lancaster with his boss and would like his mailing address to stay the same which is his mothers home.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury selection scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 18, 2023 at 09:30 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Benjamin R Everson not in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Benjamin R Everson.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Angel states BE was hoping to call in. Clerk has called the defendant states that his attorney can speak on his behalf. Attorney Angel states medical issues. Attorney Harper speaks about documentation. Attorney Harper doesn't' asks for a warrant and asks for a status in the near future. Court speaks about the age of this case and states the BE must be here in person on 10/25/22.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
September 2nd hearing moved to 10:15 am due a conflict with Atty Angel's schedule.
Letter to Judge re: Reschedule Request (Atty. Angel) - forwarded to JA
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:21 PM Defendant Benjamin R Everson in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Benjamin R Everson.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Angel informs the court that his client will waive the preliminary hearing and provides document to the court. Court binds over for trial. Attorney Harper is filing the information now and it brings forth the same charges. Attorney Angel enters a NG plea.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:11 PM Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video means for Defendant Benjamin R Everson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin R Everson appeared by phone means. Attorney Angel advises his client to waive the time limits to a preliminary hearing. BE concurs.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
